In 2011, Lively's career took a significant turn when she landed the lead role of Serena van der Woodsen in the hit TV series "Gossip Girl." The show, which aired for seven seasons from 2007 to 2012, saw her rise to stardom and established her as a prominent figure in the entertainment industry. Lively's performance as Serena was both widely praised and critically acclaimed.

Following the conclusion of "Gossip Girl," Lively continued to expand her acting repertoire, starring in films such as "The Shallows" (2016), "A Vigilante" (2018), and "The Report" (2019). She also portrayed Kate in the romantic comedy "The Five-Year Engagement" (2012) and starred in the HBO film "The Morning Show" (2021), in which she plays Alex Levy, a character who defies traditional gender norms.

Apart from her acting pursuits, Lively is a dedicated humanitarian, often participating in philanthropic endeavors.
